GTM - 2015-06-18
Virtual Training
Interact with attendees
Engaging with your audience
Using a web classroom
Need to be more interesting than what is going on around them.
Use poll questions.
     how often: about every 4 mins - seems like a lot, I would prefer every 8-10 mins
     commercial breaks happen every 8-9 mins

duration: 1 hour is typical for virtual training
     60 - 90 mins, closer to 60 mins recommended

Add poll questions. 

how many people? 

Have slide before class begins:

Book, "The Science of e-learning"

polls, breakouts, hand-outs, web cams, hand raising, 
assessments, tests, exercises

Be creative in using these tools.



Interactive, good topic, interesting trainer who listened to my questions.

Openers
Start with a webcam of yourself while you introduce yourself.

ask: What's your experience with... ?

What is goal of opener?
get participants connected with tool and each other.

Should see number of hands up.
Good for a few more people than we have in class.

virtual bingo - use drawing tool

very small group - ask everyone to turn on webcams and find something on your desk or in your
area. hold it up and show it in your webcam and tell us about it.

Games
competition not appropriate for every audience.
divide into teams and play for points
east coast / west coast , a-m n-z last name



What kind of prize? your virtual prize is to look at picture of new car, etc.

Pictionary:
Use drawing tool, guess what it is.
describe stick figure of flower. have them draw it.

Jeopardy:
Only ask a few questions



golf
wheel of fortune
quizes.com 
look for Wheel of Fortune or Jeopardy app.

Technology
Buzz-word bingo
Scavenger Hunt - have a handout - have a checklist of items to find in system.
set short timer. raise hands when done.
Review answers as group.

What if you are asking participants to answer or raise hands and they are not doing it?
Set expectations at the beginning of class by talking to them.
Use their name while talking.
Renee, in a moment, we'd like to hear about your experience.
Have co-facilitator work at interacting with them.

Put process in correct order.

Interpersonal skills
break-out sessions
Pair discussion via chat.
Assign partners, give discussion questions

Use audio breakout feature

virtual koosh ball toss.

Closers
bring topic to a close
write a few key words

quick quiz
red light, green light
Recap what we did and learned.

What are two things that you learned in class today that are important to you?
